intro: Tylophora thwaitesii, commonly known as the white-flowered tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white, tubular flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fruits are follicles that contain several seeds, and the plant is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Tylophora thwaitesii is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential medicinal properties.
